reference_a:
@article{johannes2021,
  title = {The relationship between online vigilance and affective well-being in everyday life: {{Combining}} smartphone logging with experience sampling},
  shorttitle = {The relationship between online vigilance and affective well-being in everyday life},
  author = {Johannes, Niklas and Meier, Adrian and Reinecke, Leonard and Ehlert, Saara and Setiawan, Dinda Nuranissa and Walasek, Nicole and Dienlin, Tobias and Buijzen, Moniek and Veling, Harm},
  date = {2021-09-03},
  journaltitle = {Media Psychology},
  volume = {24},
  number = {5},
  pages = {581--605},
  publisher = {Routledge},
  issn = {1521-3269},
  doi = {10.1080/15213269.2020.1768122}
}
topics: online vigilance, affect, wellbeing, smartphone, social interactions
sampling_scheme: 8x semi-random with at least 45 minutes between surveys
participants: Dutch undergraduate students using social media
additional_comments: some participants pre-excluded due to compliance by authors

features.name: time_prompt
features.coding: Time when the prompt was received

features.name: survey_taken
features.coding:
0 = No
1 = Yes

features.name: time_survey
features.coding: Likely (not clear): Time when survey was filled in

features.name: number_days_total
features.coding: On how many days did participant receive probes

features.name: fraction_of_days_with_notification
features.coding: What proportion of the total days participants received probes did the app log at least one notification

features.name: prompt_duration
features.coding: How long participants took to fill out a probe (in seconds)

features.name: phone_use
features.coding: The total time the phone was used in the 30 minutes before the probe was opened (in seconds)

features.name: social_media_use
features.coding: The total time social apps were used in the 30 minutes before the survey was opened, regardless of whether the social app use was preceded by a notification (in seconds)

features.name: social_media_use_no_notification
features.description: Social media use without notification duration
features.coding: The total time social apps were used in the 30 minutes before the survey was opened. Social app use only counted when it was not preceded by a notification from that same social app (in seconds)

features.name: reactibility_survey
features.coding: The time between receiving the survey and opening the survey (in seconds)

features.name: reactibility_notification_avg
features.coding: The average time between receiving a notification and unlocking the screen in the 30 minutes before the survey was opened (in seconds). Receiving a notification while the screen was unlocked does not count.

features.name: reactibility_notification_sd
features.coding: The standard deviation of the time between receiving a notification and unlocking the screen in the 30 minutes before the survey was opened (in seconds). Receiving a notification while the screen was unlocked does not count.

features.name: reactibility_social_notification_avg
features.coding: The average time between receiving a notification from a social app and opening that social app in the 30 minutes before the survey was opened (in seconds)

features.name: reactibility_social_notification_sd
features.coding: The standard deviation of the time between receiving a notification from a social app and opening that social app in the 30 minutes before the survey was opened (in seconds)

features.name: awake
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Tired
7 = Awake

features.name: discontent
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Content
7 = Discontent

features.name: calm
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Agitated
7 = Calm

features.name: without_energy
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Full of energy
7 = Without energy

features.name: well
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Unwell
7 = Well

features.name: tense
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Relaxed
7 = Tense

features.name: happy
features.coding:
At this moment, I feel: 
1 = Depressed
7 = Happy

features.name: stressed
features.coding:
How much stress are you experiencing right now?
1 = Not at all
7 = Very stressed

features.name: vigilance_salience_mediated
features.coding:
In the last half an hour, how much were you thinking about mediated interactions (e.g., phone calls, WhatsApp messages, Facebook likes, Instagram posts etc.)?
1 = Not at all
7 = A lot

features.name: salience_ft_f
features.coding:
In the last half an hour, how much were you thinking about face-to-face interactions?
1 = Not at all
7 = A lot

features.name: valence_mediated
features.description: Valence of thoughts on mediated interactions
features.coding:
How pleasant were those thoughts about mediated interactions?
1 = Unpleasant
7 = Pleasant

features.name: valence_ft_f
features.description: Valence of thoughts on face-to-face interactions
features.coding:
How pleasant were those thoughts about face-to-face interactions?
1 = Unpleasant
7 = Pleasant

features.name: valence_activity
features.coding:
How pleasant was what you were doing in the last half an hour?
1 = Unpleasant
7 = Pleasant

features.name: concentrated_activity_binary
features.description: Engagement in activity that required concentration
features.coding:
In the last half an hour, I was engaged in a performance-related activity (e.g., an activity for which I had to concentrate).
0 = No
1 = Yes

features.name: concentration_extent
features.coding:
The activity required all my mental capacities.
1 = Strongly disagree
7 = Strongly agree

features.name: concentrated_activity_alone
features.coding:
Did you engage in the activity alone or with others?
Alone, With others

features.name: vigilance_reactibility
features.coding:
In the last half an hour, when I received an online message, I immediately gave it my full attention.
1 = Strongly disagree
7 = Strongly agree

features.name: vigilance_monitoring
features.coding:
In the last half an hour, I was constantly monitoring what was happening online.
1 = Strongly disagree
7 = Strongly agree

features.name: social_pressure_phone
features.description: Social pressure to be available via phone
features.coding:
In the last half an hour, I felt a social obligation to be available for mediated interactions.
1 = Strongly disagree
7 = Strongly agree
